intro: Onosma subsericea, commonly known as the narrowleaf wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact, herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Onosma subsericea is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun conditions.
